learningObjectives.value: Describe sum how to measure a variety of lengths with appropriate precision using tapes, rulers and $$ \sum(x+y) $$  micrometers (including reading the scale onan analogue micrometer).

Describe qualitatively motion in a circular path due to a constant perpendicularforce, including electrostatic forces on an electron in anatom and gravitational forces on a satellite. (F = mv2 /r is notrequired.
Recall and use theequation weight = mass × gravitational field strength.
*recognise the significance of the term“limit of proportionality” for an elasticsolid (anunderstanding of the elastic limit is notrequired).
Understand that a scalarquantity hasmagnitude (size) only and that a vector quantity has magnitudeand direction.
Describe a translation by using a vector represented by e.g. x y e o, AB or a. Add and subtract vectors. Multiply a vector by a scalar.
Know that the following quantities are vectors: displacement, force, velocity, acceleration, momentum, electric field strength and gravitational field strength.
Describe sum how to measure a variety of lengths with appropriate precision using tapes, rulers and $$ \sum(x+y) $$  micrometers (including reading the scale onan analogue micrometer).

Describe qualitatively motion in a circular path due to a constant perpendicularforce, including electrostatic forces on an electron in anatom and gravitational forces on a satellite. (F = mv2 /r is notrequired.
Recall and use theequation weight = mass × gravitational field strength.
*recognise the significance of the term“limit of proportionality” for an elasticsolid (anunderstanding of the elastic limit is notrequired).
Understand that a scalarquantity hasmagnitude (size) only and that a vector quantity has magnitudeand direction.
